c74object.name: fl.lag~
c74object.digest: Delay vector type input by a whole number of frames.
c74object.description: Frames are expected to be of a uniform length. The output is the same length as the input. If the input length changes then the internal storage is reset. The object can also be reset by sending a frame to the reset input. The start parameter controls behaviour when insufficient frames are stored. The underlength output indicates that insufficient frames are stored.

entry.name: 1. /max_frames [int]
entry.description:
Sets the maximum lag value in frames.
Note that the internal buffer is reset when this changes.

entry.name: 2. /num_frames [int]
entry.description: Sets the current lag as an integer.

entry.name: 4. /start [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the behaviour when there are insufficient frames stored (as after a reset):
pad - output a frame of default values.
shorten - output the oldest input frame since the reset.
Note that frames at the reset input set the frame use for padding.
If the frame is too short or empty it is padded with the pad parameter.
[0] - pad [1] - shorten
